description: From Spanish tonto (“stupid, foolish; idiot, fool”), of uncertain etymology. Originally in US use but now chiefly British. Cf. earlier Tonto, with which it is sometimes confused.

adjectives.description: tonto (comparative more tonto, superlative most tonto)

examples: He told the businessmen that the law that required the certification by the President was ‘tonto’.

entries.meaning: (slang) Synonym of idiot: someone who is foolish or stupid.
examples: Even us tontos figured that one out.

entries.meaning: a traditional Ugandan fermented beverage made from bananas
